akn:section.akn:heading: Distribution of assets in winding up limited liability company’s activities and affairs.

akn:content.akn:p: In winding up its activities and affairs, a limited liability company shall apply its assets to discharge its obligations to creditors, including members that are creditors.
After a limited liability company complies with subsection (a) of this section, any surplus shall be distributed in the following order, subject to any charging order in effect under § 29-805.03:

If a limited liability company does not have sufficient surplus to comply with subsection (b)(1) of this section, any surplus must be distributed among the owners of transferable interests in proportion to the value of their respective unreturned contributions.
All distributions made under subsections (b) and (c) of this section must be paid in money.
